messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] (unknown)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, on the 23rd day of the sixth month of 1590, Maeda Toshiie and Uesugi Kagekatsu wiped out Hachiôji Castle. Of course, that wasn t actually June 23,
messages.messageBody:
Tom Hatfield wrote:
> i was just wondering if there were any major battles or any more well known
> samurai born on june 23?

Well, on the 23rd day of the sixth month of 1590, Maeda Toshiie and Uesugi
Kagekatsu wiped out Hachiôji Castle. Of course, that wasn't actually June 23,
though -- it was actually sometime in May.

Tony
--

Anthony J. Bryant
Website: http://www.sengokudaimyo.com

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] (unknown)
messages.msgSnippet: On Mon, 21 Jun 2004 10:05:03 -0700 (PDT), Tom Hatfield$B$5$s(B wrote in message  ... The only thing I
messages.messageBody:
On Mon, 21 Jun 2004 10:05:03 -0700 (PDT), Tom Hatfieldさん wrote in message <20040621170503.50484.qmail@...>
>i was just wondering if there were any major battles or any more well known
>samurai born on june 23?

The only thing I could find is that Kazan Tenno (the 65th emperor)
abdicated the throne on June 23, 986. Hopefully someone else can
find a bit more festive anniversary for you!

Of course the complicating factor is the changing Japanese
calendar. I would imagine that this date of adbication was June
23 as figured at the time, not _our_ June 23, on the Gregorian calenda
r. This is always the fly in the ointment with old Japanese dates.

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...
